p: The high mortality rate associated with the three pathogenic HCoVs has been mainly attributed to the development of digestive and respiratory tract injuries observed following infection. Acute atypical pneumonia and diffuse alveolar damage that progress to deposition of fibrous tissue, denuded airways, haemorrhage, and elevated macrophage infiltration are sometimes accompanied by watery diarrhoea, dehydration, and vomiting [ 2, 12, 13].
